name: Movies with the Time of Day in the Title Trivia Game | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was name of the 1939 Warner Brothers movie in which James Cagney plays a crusading reporter who is turned into a hardened criminal?
questions.explanation:
Each Dawn I Die.

	"Dawn of the Dead" is a 1979 movie about America being attacked by hordes of carnivorous zombies. "Dawn at Socorro" is a 1954 Western. "The Dawn Patrol" is a film about a World War I squadron. It was first made in 1930 and then remade in 1938. The 1938 version starred Errol Flynn, Basil Rathbone and David Niven.

questions.text: What is the plot of the 1950 British movie entitled "Morning Departure"?
questions.correct: Twelve men are caught in a trapped submarine.
options: The details are given of the last 24 hours before a train wreck.
The British Long Range Desert Group set out to track down Rommel.
This is the  story of three men who set off for the World War I trenches.
questions.explanation:
Twelve men are caught in a trapped submarine.

	On board the stricken submarine there are only eight escape outfits for the twelve men. Amongst the actors who face a life or death choice are John Mills, Richard Attenborough and Nigel Patrick.

questions.text: In which 1961 movie did Audrey Hepburn play Holly Golightly?
questions.explanation:
Breakfast at Tiffany's.

	The screenplay was written by George Axelrod and was based on the novel by Truman Capote. George Peppard played the young New York writer who lived next door to the slightly crazy Holly Golightly. Henry Mancini received the Academy Award for the music for "Moon River" whose lyrics were written by Johnny Mercer.

questions.text: Which cowboy singer sang "Do Not Forsake Me" over the title credits of "High Noon"?
questions.explanation:
Tex Ritter.

	The music to the song was written by Dmitri Tiomkin and the lyrics were by Ned Washington. Fred Zinnemann was the director and the screenplay was written by Carl Foreman from a story called "The Tin Star".

questions.text: Which crime is at the centre of the 1964 British movie entitled "Seance on a Wet Afternoon"?
options: The fixing of a horse race.
The murder of a French priest.
questions.explanation:
The kidnapping of a child.

	Richard Attenborough played the husband who kidnapped the child so that his wife, a fake medium, could claim the credit for revealing its whereabouts whilst in a trance. Kim Stanley received an Academy Award nomination for her acting in the role of the wife.

questions.text: What is the plot of the 1932 movie "Evenings for Sale" starring Herbert Marshall?
questions.correct: An impoverished Viennese count becomes a dancing master.
options: A student finds he can earn money by tightrope walking.
A  London ballet dancer turns to prostitution.
Three down-and-outs find work in a restaurant.
questions.explanation:
An impoverished Viennese count becomes a dancing master.

	The movie was put together to be a vehicle for the further success of Herbert Marshall who had just done well in "Trouble in Paradise". It was directed for Paramount by Stuart Walker.

questions.text: What was the name of the 1958 movie about the last voyage of an old sailing ship?
questions.explanation:
Twilight for the Gods.

	Ernest K. Gann wrote the screenplay from his own original novel. The leading actors were Rock Hudson, Cyd Charisse, Arthur Kennedy and Leif Erickson.

questions.text: Which industry is at the centre of the story of "Sunset Boulevard"?
questions.explanation:
The movie industry.

	The stars of the movie were Gloria Swanson and William Holden. Also featured were Erich von Stroheim, Fred Clark, Nancy Olson, Buster Keaton and Hedda Hopper. Billy Wilder was the director and Franz Waxman wrote the music.

questions.text: Which is the title of the 1955 movie directed by Charles Laughton and starring Robert Mitchum as a psychopathic preacher?
questions.explanation:
Night of the Hunter.

	The original novel was by Davis Grubb and it was turned into a screenplay by James Agee. Shelley Winters and Lillian Gish were Mitchum's co-stars.

questions.text: Who were the stars of the 1969 movie "Midnight Cowboy"?
questions.explanation:
Jon Voight and Dustin Hoffman.

	The movie was directed by John Schlesinger and won Academy Award nominations for both Voight and Hoffman. Of the other actors mentioned Burt Lancaster actually starred in a movie called "The Midnight Man".
